result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Lee Nelis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek Lee Nelis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek Lee Nelis was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Derek Lee Nelis was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations placed on a payment plan of $50 per month beginning two months after release.
Seek work and maintain full time employment.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
NO CONTACT with controlled substances users or dealers except in  group counseling. 
NO CONTACT WITH NATHAN DELANO 
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

records.addlTxt: Report of Proceedings at the Hearing on 8/1/17

Defendant Derek Lee Nelis in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF25 and 17CF41.   16CF25 SEHR and 17CF41 SEH. Ct rev'd PSI and DOC and Letters from individuals.  Letter from an Inmate that was faint in a number of places. Atty comments has clean copies from Fusak - Hands letter to Ct. DA comment no agreement on SEH. and SEHR and 16CF25. DA comments SEH on 2 cases, both similar cases. Drug Crimes.. 16CF25- 3 years 1 year init. 17CF41 8 years. 3 yrs init and 5 years ES>  DA asking for 3 years in 16cF25and 17CF41 4 years. 2 yrs init and 2 yrs ES...absol,treatment, cog, couns, NC Misty White, no dru, dna, costs DA comments lots of good things that can be said for Def, Strong Support system, Wants help with addtiction. non violent crimes.  16CF25-- same factors in that case at the time of SEH. Probation has now been revoked and here for SEH.. No issues with the PSI.  Has a Criminal record. DA opposes community supervision. Has not completed any treatment while he had the option to. Def does need treatment, State asking for the Prison system and the conditions by the DOC in the PSI.. Atty comments Page 1 in the PSI -- 17CF41 5/22/17 is the correct date, Page 7 -- completed Sex offender paperwork after release, join objection in the compass. Atty comments on SEH-- failed to meet with agent for a home visit, but was home. Was arrested for failure to pay on fines and found in possession of meth and a needle. When father passed, called probation agent and had schd a meeting with him.  Atty comments credit for ?? 51 days in 17CF41.. Agree with conditions for probation or ES. Strong support in AODA in Bad River. Atty comments Def wants to address the court and Mrs. Secord would like to make a statement., Atty wants an imposed and stayed. Ct questions -- where is the Douglas Co case at. Def comments- warrant for bail jumping, def comments particapted in his own treatment, seeking out help. Warrant in Douglas Co. Ct will hear from Ms. Secord. -- Atty comments Ms. Secord will make a statement. Ms Secord Comments- Community gets rescources for treament. When def was in Jail the first time- was in there for a short time, treatment is more successful when is a clean statement of mind. He is in a good frame of mind. difference in treatment now and time to clear his mind this time could be different. SN
Ct questions for Ms. Secord. CT comments on options of what to do with def. Ct is thinking about sentencing jail time on the SAR case and holding off on sentencing on other case until done with Douglas County. No point in placing on probation if sentencing to prison on Douglas County. Def comments on sentencing.
Ct holds off on sentencing 17CF41 until def at leasts posts bail in Douglas County.
16CF25 sentencing each count 280 days jail concurrent, good time, 210 cts-jail sentence served. Someone needs to let the court know if bail is made in Douglas co or if the cases are resolved. Atty Shawl comments on bail bond, asks if court would consider reduction in bond, Ct will consider if motion filed, comments on revocation of bail. $2500 cash bail in Ashland County, Def cannot come up with that amount, Ct comments believes right number due to record. 
SAR financial obligations, civil judgment pay through COC, payment plan needs to be developed and submitted w/in 60 days. 
17CF41 set for internal review 45 days see if any developments in Douglas County CO.
Letters of support

Defendant Derek Lee Nelis in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3 cases. DA understanding that agreement plea to Cts 1-3 in 17CF41 4-6 DRI, 16CF212 DRI. Charges and penalties read. Def plead Guilty to the 3 counts, admits repeater. 16CF212 DRI, 17CF41 cts 4-6 DRI. Def no threat/force to plea. Atty Shawl comments on facts. Ct accepts pleas and finds guilty, convicted poss meth, 2 cts FBJ repeater, Ct orders PSI. Atty Shawl has another obligation that day but believes he can move it...SEHR at the same time.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for August 1, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Richard John Shawl appeared by video means for Defendant Derek Lee Nelis. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek Lee Nelis appeared by video means. 2 cases. Atty Schawl asks for plea hearing will be asking for PSI. 16CF25 to track with.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2017 at 11:45 am.

No possess MAS-not present, UA, NC with known drug user/dealers, couns, $10 fine plus costs, DNA. Atty Perrine prob 18-24 mo 6-8mo jail, conditions same at State's, rec 201 days credit.  Def comments on sentencing. 
Sentence Each count WH 3yrs prob. 240 days jail time in Count 7 only, work and child care release, credit time served 202 days, AODA, absol, no MAS-Rx as pres-no para. UA, NC with contr sub user/dealer except in group couns, NC Nathan Delano, couns,  $567.63 each count, DNA, No gun no vote. $50 per month 2 months after release. Seek work maint full time employment
